text: One-term mayor of the pre-amalgamation City of Toronto, Cabbagetown lawyer, and community activist.
Long-time mayor of the pre-amalgamation City of North York, founder of the ‘Bad Boy’ furniture retail chain.
Long-time mayor of the pre-amalgamation City of North York, founder of the ‘Bad Boy’ furniture retail chain. Reelected to a second term in a landslide.
Environmentalist and activist who had once served as a councillor in Edmonton. Endorsed by Jane Jacobs.
While starting out as the frontrunner in her second run for the mayoralty, fell behind Miller and Tory by election day.
Former federal and provincial Conservative Party insider, journalist and talk-show host, Rogers Media and Cable CEO, CFL commissioner, and lawyer.
Lawyer, former federal Liberal and independent MP, and York borough councillor with populist leanings.
Lawyer, sometime NDP candidate, Metro Toronto councillor, and megacity councillor identified with environmental issues and anti-corruption.
Leaside resident and former York borough councillor and city councillor.
The city's second mayor was reelected on a platform of expanding transit and public amenities.
Longtime populist Etobicoke city councillor and son of a former provincial Conservative MPP became Toronto's third mayor on a platform of "respect for taxpayers."
Former Barbara Hall mayoral staffer, Cabbagetown business-owner, provincial Liberal cabinet minister and deputer premier.
Former pre-amalgamation Toronto and Metro councillor, city councillor, and deputy mayor to David Miller, representing west-central neighbourhoods, including Little Italy.
Etobicoke businessman and one-term councillor replaced his brother Rob Ford as mayoral candidate, running on a populist, back-to-basics platform.
Artist, activist, former Metro councillor, city councillor, and federal NDP MP with deep roots in Toronto's Hong Kong Chinese community.
Elected amalgamated Toronto's fourth mayor on a centrist platform after an unsuccessful tenure as provincial Conservative leader and serving as chair of CivicAction.
Successfully ran for reelection to a second term.
Urban planner with substantial experience in the private sector and chief planner of Toronto under Ford and Tory.
Successfully ran for reelection to a third term.
Colombian immigrant, urban policy consultant, and founder of the non-profit 8 80 Cities.
Policy analyst and former member of the Toronto Youth Cabinet.
